intro: Otostegia scariosa, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple, which bloom in the early morning and close by midday. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water in drought conditions. Otostegia scariosa plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
